title: Heritance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a youthful wine, softened by tiny additions of Merlot and Petit Verdot. Peppery black spice, leather and cedar accent compressed black fruit on the palate, bolstered by a sizable tannic structure.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Petite Sirah (San Diego County)
description: Cassis, roasted chocolate, pepper and buttery pastries show on the nose of this bottling, which is thick and dark in the glass and shows great potential for this grape in Southern California. It's dense on the palate, with soft violet and blackberry flavors, wrapped in a tarry structure with hints of nutmeg and cocoa on the finish.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Syrah (San Diego County)
description: Cooked cherries, wild chaparral and toasted oak aromas show on this estate bottling from a promising project in San Diego County. It's a classic, down-the-middle Syrah on the palate, where savory herbs of sage and thyme spice up the boysenberry fruit, with vanilla, star anise and mint arising toward the finish.

title: Il Brunone 2011 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, this has aromas of plum cake, leather, and vanilla. The ripe, savory palate offers juicy blackberry, star anise, white pepper and a touch of almond alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Domaine des Billards  (Saint-Amour)
description: This powerful wine offers rich texture and layers of tannin balanced by juicy black fruits and crisp acidity. This wine, from a southeast-facing slope, is ripe, ready to drink from 2019.

title: Jules Taylor 2016 Chardonnay (Marlborough)
description: This is a classy, food friendly wine from a winemaker of consistent quality. Aromas of peach, melon and guava harmonize with a hint of butter and toast on the nose. The palate delivers understated balance and finesse, simultaneously slippery and grainy in texture, finishing with a guava zing.

title: Kasteelberg 2015 Chardonnay (Swartland)
description: This wine leads with rich and mature notes of toasted apple skin, honeycomb cereal, creamed melon and grilled peach. It's a touch round and soft upon entry, but the palate received a welcome lift from ample acidity and an ensuring sweet-spice finish, reminiscent of spiced orange rind and baked apple. Drink now–2020.

title: Kokomo 2015 Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: This hearty red is made from nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Grenache, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah and Merlot. Juicy and structured in black and red cherry and currant, it offers sizable tannin weight and a grip of toasted oak, remaining succulent and bright in the glass.

title: Laurence Féraud 2013  Gigondas
description: Fleshy and full on the palate, this plump red wine offers heaps of juicy, easy black-cherry and berry flavors peppered with spice and mocha. It's a rich, mouthfilling sip but tightens up firmly, with a bold, tannic finish.

title: Lavau 2015  Gigondas
description: Whiffs of black-cherry preserves dusted in sweet spice introduce this unctuously fruity red. It's a straightforward, juicy wine but boldly concentrated with flavors of sun-kissed plums and berries that linger through a long, softly tannic finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Madrigal 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Dark black color gives way to brooding ripeness and density of black fruit, with a huge presence of oak and tannin. Aspects of leather, black pepper and tomato leaf figure into the mix, saved by a brightness of acidity that helps complement the wine's concentrated tendencies.

title: Maison Denuzière 2015 Domaine des Hunaudieres Red (Luberon)
description: Punchy blackberry and cherry flavors abound in this straightforward yet delightfully juicy wine. Ripe, yielding tannins and sunny acidity accentuate its approachable, appealing style but elegant touches of mint and spice lend flair to the finish.

title: Marrenon 2015 Grand Marrenon Red (Luberon)
description: Heady tones of violet, lavender and smoke persist from nose to finish in this opulent, elegant wine. The palate is concentrated and juicy, offering loads of succulent blackberry and plum flavors peppered with spice and bramble. The finish is long and persistent, marked by chalky but firm tannins.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Intensely oaky and robustly built, this young white mellows in the glass to reveal a voluptuous citrus core. It offers vibrancy on the finish that plays well against bold flavors of pear and melon.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2014 Tempranillo (Lake County)
description: This is a big full-bodied wine that packs a bounty of ripe bold fruit flavors into a firm frame of tannins, alcohol and moderate acidity. It has a big impact on the palate with the concentration to back it up. Big proteins will pair nicely with it.

title: Pardon et Fils 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: Spice, cherries and some tannins are the order of the day in this wine. Tannins are present although not dominant, giving a wine that is more to do with rich berry fruits and black cherries. Still developing, the wine will be better from late 2018.

title: Phillips Hill 2016 Boontling Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Earthy aromas and a smooth texture drive this unorthodox but attention-getting wine, which is the entry-level wine from Phillips Hill and named for the local dialect in Anderson Valley. It has funky reduced aromas at first, then meaty stemmy spicy flavors and a mouth-filling texture that's very smooth.

title: Pio Cesare 2013 Ornato  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of exotic spice, underbrush, chopped herb and moist earth lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers raw sour cherry, star anise, espresso and oak-driven spice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Give the tannins a few more years to come around then drink to capture its subtle fruit flavors.

title: Podere Capaccia 2014  Chianti Classico
description: A blend of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Ancellotta, this opens with aromas of violet, black-skinned berry and cooking spice. The fresh, savory palate offers juicy black cherry, clove, white pepper and a hint of aromatic herb. It's balanced, with fine-grained tannins, lively acidity and good mid-term aging potential. Drink through 2024.

title: Poggio Torselli 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this offers aromas of bell pepper, moist earth and cooking spice. The firm palate delivers Marasca cherry, white pepper and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Richard Rottiers 2016 La Sambinerie  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This warm, ripe wine is full of rich black fruit and light tannins. It is dense but has a refreshing light touch of acidity. Savor this wine now for its fruitiness.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Alverd White (Yolo County)
description: An abundance of floral and savory flavors drives this full-bodied, dry and mouth-filling wine. It's not fruity per se, but has a good core of white peach along with almond and white-tea notes. This 50-50 blend of Albariño and Verdelho will bring a welcome change of pace to the table.

title: RouteStock 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This perennial value delivers again in a juicy and elegant expression of concentrated black fruit, black olive and tomato leaf, a nice complement of succulent and savory. Stock up.

title: San Fabiano Calcinaia 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Made with organic grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, baking spice and a hint of nutmeg. The concentrated palate delivers red plum, mocha and white pepper alongside taut tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Schandl 2015 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)
description: Highly aromatic notes of raspberry and wild strawberry immediately charm the nose. These notes carry to a rich flourish across the supple palate. There is warmth countered by lovely freshness and some bite. A wine with immense charm.

title: Schandl 2015 Ried Kreften Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Chocolate and mocha set a rich tone on the nose amidst plum and black cherry fruit. The palate falls in with mellow, smooth tannins and a vanilla edge to its lovely cherry fruit. There is freshness, too. A modern, international and fruit-driven style with immediate charm.

title: Shalestone 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Despite the tough, rain-filled vintage, this is a strong showing from a producer that focuses on red grape varieties. A pristine nose of bramble berries, wild herbs, crushed black pepper and graphite sit over a core of dark cherry. Medium in body, silken in feel and supported by fine-grained tannins, the palate is persistent in tart dark cherry and cranberry, with more graphite and black pepper lingering on the finish.

title: Te Mata 2015 Cape Crest Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)
description: Lifted aromas of stone and passion fruit, lime and flowers meld with with an almond butter note on the nose. It's the palate that turns things up a notch with its chalky texture, mouth-watering acidity and more citrus and floral flavors.

title: The Federalist 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This is a bold wine, showing smoky, toasted oak aromas to bolster ripe pear and apple flavors that are accented by vanilla and cream. It's not something delicate for fresh seafood, but will taste great with a roast chicken or pizza bianco.

title: Villa Calcinaia 2015 Piegaia  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of black currant, underbrush and a hint of bay leaf are front and center. The juicy, savory palate delivers black cherry, cassis, clove and green peppercorn alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2021.
